programme.desc: One entrepreneur claims a nine-figure sale of his last business, while another has only been in business for six months.

programme.title: NYC Innovates
programme.desc: Discover the innovators behind NYC's changing landscape, from Central Park to Brooklyn's Domino Park; an inside look inside Soho's high-tech social wellness club.

programme.title: NYC Revealed
programme.desc: New York has long been known as one of the rattiest cities in the U.S., with some estimating close to two million rodents roam its streets; both city workers and residents have been waging a never-ending battle against these four-legged fiends.

programme.title: NYC Revealed
programme.desc: The yellow taxi cab is the quintessential New York City ride; what started as a small fleet of cars nearly 100 years ago, has turned into a bustling system of thousands of yellow taxi cabs.

programme.title: NYC Revealed
programme.desc: Many things come to mind when thinking about New York City, but how the city deals with its garbage is usually not one of them; New Yorkers produce over 14 million tons of trash each year.

programme.title: NYC Revealed
programme.desc: Underneath the ground of New York's fabled streets exists a vast network of pipes that make up the city's sewer system; New Yorkers create, on average, 1.3 billion gallons of wastewater per day that makes its way through these 7,500 miles of pipes.

programme.title: Business of Fashion
programme.desc: Designer Rebecca Minkoff celebrates 20 years; Arc'teryx unveils new NYC flagship; Vetir launches AI-powered shopping; On introduces spray-on running shoes.

programme.title: Business of Beauty
programme.desc: Cosmetic dentist designs celebrity smiles; new lazer zaps unwanted tattoos; Elysium develops "Fountain of Youth" pill.

programme.sub-title: Watch the Company That Landed a $175,000 Investment

programme.desc: Stuart Haselden is the CEO of Arc'teryx; Arc'teryx is a Canadian apparel company specializing in outdoor apparel and equipment headquartered in North Vancouver, British Columbia; it focuses on technical apparel for mountaineering and Alpine sports.
